meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed some tranqs to help the patient relax.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper used tranqs to calm down the agitated elephant.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat mistook the tranqs for treats and dozed off in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The tranquil garden was like a natural tranqs for the stressed-out visitors.
meanings.sent5: The calming effect of the tranqs was almost immediate, easing the tension in the room.

meanings.definition: Tranqs (verb): To administer tranquilizers to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The vet had to tranqs the anxious dog before the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The wildlife rescue team had to tranqs the injured bird for treatment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey tried to tranqs its friend as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The music was so soothing, it seemed to tranqs the entire audience into a peaceful state.
meanings.sent5: The trainer gently tranqs the nervous horse before the competition to keep it calm.
